intro: Aeollanthus buettneri, commonly known as the Buetner's aeollanthus, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in full sun. Aeollanthus buettneri is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to withstand salt spray and drought conditions.
